snippet: ALEXANDER--Doris, formerly of 444 East 57th Street, New York City, comfortably passed away on March 6th surrounded by her loving family. She is survived by her daughters Kim Alexander and Joan Alexander-Bianchi, grandson Alexander Bianchi, son-in-law Dr. Edgardo Bianchi, Cousin Laura Edelstein, and Alexandra Borgia. Mrs. Alexander was a successful business woman and lover of the arts. Although she was an intrepid world traveler, the place she loved the most was New York City. 1/3
lead_paragraph: ALEXANDER--Doris, formerly of 444 East 57th Street, New York City, comfortably passed away on March 6th surrounded by her loving family. She is survived by her daughters Kim Alexander and Joan Alexander-Bianchi, grandson Alexander Bianchi, son-in-law Dr. Edgardo Bianchi, Cousin Laura Edelstein, and Alexandra Borgia. Mrs. Alexander was a successful business woman and lover of the arts. Although she was an intrepid world traveler, the place she loved the most was New York City. 1/3
